title: South Leicester RFC
text:
South Leicester Rugby Football Club is an <a href="England">English</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> team based in <a href="Wigston">Wigston</a>, <a href="Leicestershire">Leicestershire</a> - just south of <a href="Leicester">Leicester</a>. The club runs two senior sides, plus a colts side and a full set of junior teams. The first XV were playing in the <a href="Midlands%20Premier">Midlands Premier</a>, the fifth tier of the <a href="English%20rugby%20union%20system">English rugby union system</a>, following their relegation from <a href="National%20League%202%20North">National League 2 North</a> at the end of the 2018–19 season, however, due to a run of bad results and a number of players leaving the club, they have withdrawn from the Midlands Premier.
History.
South Leicester Rugby Club was formed in 1919. A history of the early years of the club can be found on the club's website
